intro: Pleocnemia stenosemioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pleocnemia, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its simple, non-vascular structure and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant exhibits a thalloid body, which is a flat, ribbon-like structure covered in a layer of green cells. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia located on the upper surface of the thallus. This species is typically found in temperate regions and is often associated with forest floor habitats.
